dR/dt = -rR + m
  -  R is the number of transcripts
  -  r is the rate of decay of existing transcripts
  -  m is the number of new transcripts produced per second

##Opgave 1:
[1].  R, r & m
[2].  

##Opgave 2:
```{r}
library(deSolve)

time <- seq(0, 100, by = 1)
para <- c(r = 0, m = 0)
state <- c(R = 100)

Calculate.mRNA <- function(time, R, para){
  with(as.list(c(para)),{
    dR <- -r * (R + m)
    return(list(c(dR)))
  }
       )
  
}

result <- ode(time = time,
              y = state,
              parms = para,
              func = Calculate.mRNA,
              method = "euler")


para <- c(r = 0.25, m = 5)
result_increasing <- ode(time = time,
                         y = state,
                         parms = para,
                         func = Calculate.mRNA,
                         method = "euler")

para <- c(r = 0.25, m = -5)
result_decreasing <- ode(time = time,
                         y = state,
                         parms = para,
                         func = Calculate.mRNA,
                         method = "euler")

plot(result, result_increasing, result_decreasing)
```
